required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of GC022F CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for Relapsed or Refractory B- NHL
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of GC022F CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for Relapsed or Refractory B- NHL

brief_summary.textblock: The study is an early, open, single-centered trial. The aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerance of GC022F CAR-T cell immunotherapy in relapsed or refractory B-NHL. The investigators plan to include 18 subjects to receive GC022F therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Type and incidence of DLT, incidence and severity of treatment related AE, CRS and Neurotoxicity (Safety and tolerability)
primary_outcome.description: AE will be collected and graded according to ASTCT consensus(for Cytokine Release Syndrome, CRS and Immune Effector Cell-Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome, ICANS) and CTCAE v5.0(for AE except CRS/ICANS)

secondary_outcome.measure: CAR copies of GC022F in peripheral blood, bone marrow, CSF and tumor tissue (amplification and persistence)
secondary_outcome.description: GC022F CAR copies in peripheral blood, tumor tissue, bone marrow and CSF will be measured by qPCR in 2 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: CAR cells of GC022F in peripheral blood, bone marrow and CSF (amplification and persistence)
secondary_outcome.description: GC022F CAR cells in peripheral blood, bone marrow and CSF will be measured by FCM in 2 years.
ORR will be calculated as the percents of patients who achieved CR or PR.
DOR will be calculated as the time from the first assessment of CR or PR to the first assessment of relapse or death from any cause.
PFS will be calculated as the time from CAR-T infusion to disease progression or death from any cause (whichever occurs first).
OS will be calculated as the time from CAR-T infusion to death from any cause.

arm_group.description: The patients will receive GC022F CAR-T treatment. GC022F dosage ranges from 3×10^5 to 1×10^6 CAR+T/Kg.

intervention.description: GC022F is a bispecific CAR-T cell immunotherapy that targeted CD19 and CD22. The dosage ranges from 3×10^5 to 1×10^6 CAR+T/Kg.
